MutableTree
Class MutableTree

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--MutableTree.MutableTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
Leaf, Node
public abstract class MutableTree
extends java.lang.Object

MutableTree defines the data type of binary trees that can be altered once they are constructed. Important: substructures of this form of tree _cannot_ be shared! Forms of this tree are intended to be:
(i) a leaf, which holds the address of its parent node (if any), or
(ii) a node that holds a value, a left subtree, a right subtree, and the address of its parent node (if any).
Methods listed below should be overridden as needed by subclasses.

Constructor Summary

Method Summary
 MutableTree left()
          left returns the left subtree of this tree
abstract  Node parent()
          parent returns the address of the parent node to this tree
 void printContents()
          printContents prints all the values held within a binary tree; the tree is traversed left-to-right _pre-order_ (value printed first), formatted and labelled so that you can see the tree's structure
 MutableTree right()
          right returns the right subtree of this tree
 void setLeft(MutableTree t)
          setLeft resets the left subtree of this tree

public void printContents()
